text.p: These are the leading stories in the Mozambican press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- A congress of Mozambique's ruling Frelimo party will decide on a president and a new central committee on Friday. The party's leadership yesterday proposed the incumbent President Joaquim Chissano for re-election.
- Leaders of one of Mozambique's opposition parties, lawyer Maximo Dias, said he believed Frelimo would win the next general election in 1999.
